data.text: Parson says getting an acting director in the position brings stability to the department.

Parson says he will wait and see whether she will be an acting director and serve in that capacity until his term ends in three years. Or, she could go through Missouri Senate confirmation proceedings in hopes of becoming a permanent director.

Gov. Parson has named Nickelson as the acting director. Parson named Nickelson after a group of Missouri Senate Conservative Caucus members blocked the governorâ€™s previous nomination of Don Kaeurauf to lead the agency.
